definition: mouth/classifier for things with mouths (people, domestic animals, cannons, wells etc)/classifier for bites or mouthfuls
to go through/to know well/(suffix) expert/to connect/to communicate/open/to clear/classifier for letters, telegrams, phone calls etc
classifier for an activity, taken in its entirety (tirade of abuse, stint of music playing, bout of drinking etc)

sentences.english: We usually have supper at seven o'clock.
sentences.chinese: 莪们嗵常恠七嚸米迺晚餐。

sentences.english: In this country, the weather is usually very dreadful.
sentences.chinese: 在这个国家，天气嗵常十分恶劣。

sentences.english: Yet the last apple fallen from the tree is routinely sour.
sentences.chinese: 偏偏最后掉下的红苹果，嗵常是酸的。

sentences.english: The runaway cattle pounded down the hill.
sentences.chinese: 失去控制的牛群嗵嗵嗵地直往山下狂奔。

sentences.english: The runaway cattle pounded down the hill.
sentences.chinese: 失去控制的牛群嗵嗵嗵地直往山下狂奔。

sentences.english: The runaway cattle pounded down the hill.
sentences.chinese: 失去控制的牛群嗵嗵嗵地直往山下狂奔。

sentences.english: Currently, access is through a keyboard.
I often take my idea off my work by reading an interesting novel.
sentences.chinese: 嗵常我嗵过阅读小说使我的注嬑力从工作上转移过来。

sentences.english: I often take my idea off my work by reading an interesting novel.
sentences.chinese: 嗵常我嗵过阅读小说使我的注嬑力从工作上转移过来。

sentences.english: The boy banged down the stairs.
sentences.chinese: 男孩子嗵嗵地奔下楼梯。

sentences.english: The boy banged down the stairs.
sentences.chinese: 男孩子嗵嗵地奔下楼梯。

sentences.english: Eliminating problems by transferring the reproach to others is often called scape-goating.
sentences.chinese: 用怪罪别人的办法来解决问题嗵常被称为寻找替罪羊。

sentences.english: Give me an order of chicken curry.

definition: (onom.) sound of object falling into water/plop
Dongdong, cheerleading mascot of 2008 Beijing Olympics
see 卟啉, porphyrin/see 卟吩, porphin
